description: Restore program-state information. The state information, resulting from a previous 'model save' command, is in the save file s. If s does not contain a file extension, then the extension '.f3sav' is added. The path to the save file can be included as part of s. All model state information (including any defined FISH functions/variables, histories, tables, or model components) is lost and replaced by the information contained in the file s. Information that is part of the project state (see 'project') or program state (see 'program') is not affected by a restore.
notes: Restores state information from previous 'model save' command
Default file extension: '.f3sav' (added if not specified)
Path can be included in filename
ALL current model state is LOST and replaced by saved state
- All model components (balls, clumps, walls, contacts, etc.)
Project state (see 'project' command) is NOT affected
Program state (see 'program' command) is NOT affected
IMPORTANT: After restore, call 'model clean' before modifying extent tolerances
Use for: checkpoint recovery, continuing simulations, loading initial states
Complement command: 'model save' creates the save files

examples.description: Restore model from checkpoint file (explicit extension)
Restore model from checkpoint (extension '.f3sav' added automatically)
Restore from file with absolute path
Restore from file with relative path (extension added)

examples.command:
model restore 'initial_state'
model cycle 5000
model save 'after_5000_cycles'
examples.description: Restore checkpoint, run more cycles, save new state

examples.command:
model restore 'base_configuration'
model gravity 9.81
model solve
model save 'with_gravity'
examples.description: Restore base state, add gravity, solve, save new configuration

examples.command:
model restore 'saved_state.sav'
model clean
clump tolerance extent 0.02
examples.description: After restore, must clean before modifying extent tolerances

examples.command:
model restore 'problem1_equilibrium'
; Continue simulation from equilibrium
wall attribute velocity-y -0.1 range id 1
model cycle 10000
examples.description: Restore equilibrium state and continue with new loading

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model restore "filename.f3sav"') - Python SDK does not provide direct restore function. Note: Use double quotes around filename in command string if path contains spaces
